meaning_str.bing:
num. 一百万；大量
n. 无数；百万元；百万(镑,美元,法郎)
网络. 百万个；兆；百万社

无数；百万元；百万(镑,美元,法郎)

百万；一百万；百万个单位；百万元；（人或物的）百万个；无数；许多；大众；群众
一百万的；百万的；数以百万计的；许多的；大量的；无数的

sogou-kaoyan.n: 百万[出现20次)];无数; 大量[出现0次)]

sogou-CET6.adj/n: 百万[出现29次)];无数; 许许多多[出现5次)]

sogou-CET4.adj/n: 百万[出现44次)];无数; 许许多多[出现10次)]

sogou-gaokao.adj/n: 百万[出现5次)];无数; 许许多多[出现1次)]

1.en: International agencies trying to help more than two million storm survivors regret the loss of the navy's resources.
1.cn: 试图帮助两百多万风灾幸存者的国际援助机构对失去美国海军提供的救灾物资表示遗憾。

2.en: But so far, the total number of smartphone users is still far lower than Facebook's 400 million people.
2.cn: 但是到目前为止，智能手机用户数量还远低于Facebook的4亿人口。

3.en: When she told the millionaire that he had forty-two million dollars, he was wild with joy and asked, "How much pay do you want? "
3.cn: 当她告诉富翁他有四千二百万美元的时候，富翁欣喜若狂并且问她，：“你想要我付给你多少呢？”

0.en: The year I turned 26, as the head of my own brokerage firm, I made 49 million dollars, which really pissed me off, because it was three shy of a million a week.
0.cn: 我26岁那年依靠自己的股票经纪公司赚了4千9百万，这让我超级不爽的，就差那么3百万就可以一周赚1百万了。

1.en: I could eat about a million and a half of these.
1.cn: 我能吃掉上百万块巧克力。

2.en: It will map 10 million stars in our galaxy and a million other galaxies beyond.
2.cn: 将能把我们银河系中的一千万颗星球和其他上百万个星系尽收眼底。

3.en: And I made that, so, you know, I know it's gonna be like a million times harder to give up a baby but, oh my God, it's gonna feel like a million times better, right?
3.cn: 这是我的功劳，所以，我知道送走自己生出来的孩子一定会难上百万倍，但到时的快乐一定也会是百万倍，对吧？

4.en: She wants to bring us $38 million in business. I don't see the downside.
4.cn: 她要给我们带来3千8百万的生意，我不觉得有什么不好的。

5.en: We're not gonna pay $17 million to players. I'm not asking you for 10 or 20, 30 million dollars. I'm just asking for a bit of help.
5.cn: 我们不会付给球员一千七百万。我没有问你要一千万，两千万或三千万美元，我只想多一点支持。

6.en: Oprah gave Lindsay $2 million, Cunnilingus gave Michael Douglas throat cancer.
6.cn: 奥普拉赔偿林赛2百万美元，迈克尔·道格拉斯因为总给别人口交而得了喉癌。

7.en: 12 million people live here now, feeding the largest manufacturing base in the world.
7.cn: 现居住于此的一千两百万人正源源不断地向世界上最大的制造基地输送人才。

8.en: With a population of over twelve million people, the French capital is at the heart of the Ile-de-France region.
8.cn: 拥有超过一千两百万人口，是法国的首都，位在法兰西岛的心脏地带。

9.en: Some 65 million years ago, a monster 6 miles wide may have wiped out half the species on Earth.
9.cn: 大约6500百万年前，一个6英里宽的大怪物，可能消灭了地球上半数的物种。

10.en: Home to over 8 million people, the capital of the UK has been an important financial, educational and cultural center for hundreds of years.
10.cn: 这里是英国的首都，人口超过 8 百万，几百年来都是金融、敎育和文化的重镇。

11.en: Are there really dinosaurs here? No, just pretend ones. Real dinosaurs died out 65 million years ago.
11.cn: 请问这地方真的有恐龙吗？没有，这只有一些假扮的恐龙。好吧！真正的恐龙早在六千五百万年前就灭绝了。

12.en: There was a time before humans and there's gonna be a time after. It could be tomorrow, it could be a million years from now.
12.cn: 既然有人类出现之前的纪年，就会有人类消失后的纪年。也许就在明天，也许会在百万年以后。

13.en: No. No. I support you 100%. I just didn't, I didn't get it right away. You know now I'm caught up. Identical hand twins. It's a million-dollar idea.
13.cn: 不，我百分之百支持你，只是我一时没回过神来，我现在懂了，双胞手！这点子值上百万。

14.en: Well, based on the fact that our potential market is about 70 or 80 guys, and you want a submarine, I'd say about a million dollars a pop.
14.cn: 这个嘛，基于我们的潜在市场大约七八十人的事实，而你又想赚个潜水艇，我的意见是一单一百万刀。

15.en: Every day, this system carries over 5 million passengers citywide. Without it, traffic would overwhelm Manhattan streets, and the city couldn't function.
15.cn: 每天这个系统搭载着超过5百万全市乘客没有地铁，地面的交通将会拥挤不堪整座城市也会瘫痪。

16.en: And one of Dawson's first acts as governor was to approve a $12 million grant for that man, Jerrod Wilkins, software engineer, 41 years old, recently divorced.
16.cn: 道森身为州长的第一步就是批款一千两百万给那个人，杰罗德·威尔金斯，软件工程师，四十一岁，刚刚离婚。

17.en: For 41 million, you built a playoff team. You lost Damon, Giambi, Isringhausen, Pena, and you won more games without them than you did with them.
17.cn: 你用四千一百万打造了一支打进季后赛的球队，没有戴蒙，吉昂比，伊斯林豪森，佩纳，没有了他们，你还赢了更多的比赛。

18.en: It is a light that has remained undimmed, and which now attracts 42 million visitors a year, making Paris the most visited city in all the world.
18.cn: 许多宏观前卫的想法都在这个时期诞生。而这股光明从未黯淡，如今每年吸引着四千两百万游客前来造访，使巴黎成为全世界游客人数最多的城市。

19.en: With an estimated 2 million pills being smuggled into the US every day and of students at universities like Stanford saying they have tried it, MDMA or Molly has become a popular drug of choice.
19.cn: 估计每天约有两百万颗摇头丸输入美国，三分之一的大学生表示试过摇头丸，连史丹佛学生也不例外MDMD(摇头丸)，别名"茉莉"，已经成为很流行的药物了。
